author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of the Tamil Nadu Rural Development Officers Association observed a fast on Wednesday to draw the attention of the government towards their 15-point charter of demands.

The association demanded filling up of vacancies in the department and grant of salary for panchayat secretaries on par with junior assistants.

They also wanted the government to grant Rs. 15,600 scale of pay for block development officers and promotion opportunities for qualified panchayat secretaries. Among other demands was the scrapping of additional departmental examination for direct recruitment assistants and creation of promotion opportunities for supervisors, who possess engineering qualification and have completed five years service.

Around 800 members of the association from Vellore, Krishnagiri, Tiruvannamalai and Tiruvallur districts took part in the regional-level hunger protest.
title: Association observes fast to put forward demands
